page.title: 14ATTITUDES TO RURAL LIFE-B
page.content:
CONTINUED FROM PAGE 13
ONE ADVANTAGE OF LIVING IN THE COUNTRY IS WAKING UP IN THE MORNING AND HEARING ALL THE BIRDS SINGING-THIS IS VERY PLEASANT INDEED.ALSO WHEN YOU GO FOR WALKS,YOU CAN SEE SO MANY ANIMALS. ONE DISADVANTAGE IS THAT YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL INTO COLCHESTER IF YOU WANT TO BUY ANYTHING OTHER THAN GROCERIES.IF YOU DO NOT GET A LIFT INTO TOWN BY CAR IT TAKES SO LONG BY BUS.THERE ARE NOT THAT MANY PLACES FOR US TO PLAY,SINCE WE ARE NOT ALLOWED IN TO MOST OF THE FIELDS.ONE ADVANTAGE WE HAVE,IS THAT PEOPLES GARDENS ARE BIGGER THAN IN THE TOWN,SO WE USUALLY CAN PLAY MUCH BETTER GAMES IN THEM.I LIKE LIVING IN THE COUNTRY,BUT I WOULD LIE TO LIVE IN THE TOWN,JUST TO SEE WHAT THE DIFFERENCE WAS LIKE. LISA BURGESS.
